for its fresh fruit, is a city in the Theni District of

People coming by train have a convenient train head at Kodai road. At 5AM a private bus from kodai road starts to Periyakulam. Kodai road is at about 45 km form periyakulam. If you miss that bus, don't worry . You can take a bus to Batlagundu and from there you can reach Periyakulam easily.

Another way is to get down at Madurai or Dindigul Railway station.

From Madurai, a passenger train starts at 7.45 AM , which comes to Theni which is 16 km from Periyakulam and it is well connected by road.

Periyakulam is well connected with major cities of tamilnaduby bus service. Mainly with

, Coimbatore.

Nearest air port : Madurai 87 km, Trichy 170 km

In addition to this there is a bus to Madurai and Dindugal every 15 minutes, and for every 5 minutes there is a bus to Theni.

Vaigai dam can be reached by taking the Andipatty bus at the periyakulam bus stand which has a bus frequency of 20 minutes.

Inside the town mini buses ply every 10 minutes to the nook and corner of the town.

Autos and Horse carts are also available
